utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Would you mind starting with telling me what brought you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure I have had this cough for the past five days and it doesn't seem to be getting any better so I'm just here to ask you what it what it possibly could be.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has the cough been getting any better, staying the same or getting worse over these last five days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think it's getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you bringing up any any phlegm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Okay, are you bringing up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you been coughing at night time as well? Is it interfering with your sleep? Or is the cough just during the day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it is mostly during the day and in the evenings, it doesn't wake me up from sleep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any triggers that you've notice 5 days ago or anything that changed at that time to bring on the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you been having any other symptoms with the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have a sore throat and I feel like I can't taste things the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, are you having any pain with swallowing either liquids or food?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, mostly with foods.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did the sore throat start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It started up around the same time as my cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you can't taste your food as well, and when did you notice that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That was two days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you noticed any any loss of smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had any difficulties breathing or short of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any symptoms like this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like this.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how has your energy level been? Have you been fatigued?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: A little bit, yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you had any changes to your vision or or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any mucous or pain or discharge from either your ears or nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so your nose hasn't been runny, but has it felt congested?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you had any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't know about fevers. I guess I was feeling a little bit hot last night, but I didn't take my temperature.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so possibly a fever. I will certainly check your temperature today to investigate that. Have you had any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no night sweats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And have you had any weight loss in the last few months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you had any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you noticed any heart palpitations or heart racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Right, OK, have you had any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And have you had any abdominal pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about any urinary problems?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Problems like diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any muscle aches or or body pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so the cough started 5 days ago, you had a sore throat, you've been feeling a bit more tired and haven't been able to taste your food for the last couple of days.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, nothing you see a physician regularly for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, do you take any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, do you know if you have any allergies to medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, possibly penicillin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you know what the reaction was?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think I had a rash.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are your immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think, yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Excellent and any surgeries before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you been in the hospital for any reason?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And are you in school now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm in grade 6.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, cool, what's your favorite class?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say it's math.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Awesome and has there been anybody in your class who's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, everything's virtual right now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK cool, so have you traveled anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and who are you living with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with two of my younger siblings and my mom and dad.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is there any physical or verbal abuse in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you do feel safe in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and I know some people in your age group might even start using other types of substances. Have you noticed anything like that, or have you used anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And so do you drink? do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have had a sip of wine, but that's that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, great. And has anybody in your family had had similar symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um and anybody in the family have asthma or lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think my aunt has asthma but I was I was checked for asthma when I was younger and it turns out I don't have it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any diseases that run in the family like genetic or congenital?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think Crohn's disease.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and umm, who in the family has that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My father.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so that was everything that I wanted to ask today, was there anything else you wanted to tell me?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's it. What do you think I have?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Well, it is sounding like it could be most likely an infectious type of process going on with the possibility of having a fever with a cough and sore throat. So we'll do a physical exam and also some investigations which will include a covid test today. Because some of these symptoms do overlap, but it could be something like the common cold. I don't know the virus that's bringing this on but it's not necessarily covid. But because we're doing the test, it will require 14 days of self isolation. We'll get back to you with the results as quickly as we can.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
